name: Chicken Pesto Pizza
description: The absolute perfect weeknight meal that comes together in minutes! Use leftover rotisserie chicken, fresh tomatoes, pesto and cheese!

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Lightly coat a baking sheet or pizza pan with olive oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Lightly coat a baking sheet or pizza pan with olive oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Working on a surface that has been sprinkled with cornmeal, roll out the pizza into a 12-inch-diameter round. Transfer to prepared baking sheet or pizza pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Working on a surface that has been sprinkled with cornmeal, roll out the pizza into a 12-inch-diameter round. Transfer to prepared baking sheet or pizza pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Using a small ladle, spread pesto over the surface of the dough in an even layer, leaving a 1/2-inch border.
recipeInstructions.name: Using a small ladle, spread pesto over the surface of the dough in an even layer, leaving a 1/2-inch border.

recipeInstructions.text: Top with mozzarella, dollops of ricotta, chicken and tomatoes.
recipeInstructions.name: Top with mozzarella, dollops of ricotta, chicken and tomatoes.

recipeInstructions.text: Place into oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheeses have melted.
recipeInstructions.name: Place into oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheeses have melted.

review.reviewBody: Easy to make and delicious to eatthanks for the recipe!  I’ll be making this again and again

I don’t like ricotta so instead I did a handful of Italian mixed cheese and this pizza turned out so good! I also used my own pizza dough. But still, this pizza was so good! Definitely keeping this one.
So delicious! What is the nutrition serving size? One slice? Thanks again for a yummy meal!
I love this pizza!  I am having trouble pinning it to my Pinterest.  Why?
